thread.title: Here's Every Time Meryl Streep Has Been Up For An Oscar
thread.title_full: Here's Every Time Meryl Streep Has Been Up For An Oscar

author: Hal Rhorer
title: Here's Every Time Meryl Streep Has Been Up For An Oscar

organizations.name: academy of motion picture arts and sciences

text:
Ok, c l. ID: 10395391 So, let’s just take a trip down Queen Meryl’s memory lane and look at every time she has been nominated for (or won) an Academy Award. ID: 10395438 3. 1979: Nominated for Best Supporting Actress in The Deer Hunter View this image ›
Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences Scratching her leg. Legendary.
ID: 10395460 4. 1980: Won the Oscar for Best Supporting Actress in Kramer vs. Kramer View this image ›
ASSOCIATED PRESS / Via AP ID: 10395817 5. 1982: Nominated for Best Actress in The French Lieutenant’s Woman View this image ›
Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences / Via youtube.com ID: 10395917 6. 1983: Won the Oscar for Best Actress in Sophie’s Choice View this image ›
Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences / Via youtube.com ID: 10395941 7. 1984: Nominated for Best Actress in Silkwood View this image ›
Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences / Via The soft smile, I can’t breathe. The soft smile! I am no longer able to speak.
ID: 10395965 8. 1986: Nominated for Best Actress in Out Of Africa View this image ›
Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences / Via youtube.com ID: 10396001 9. 1988: Nominated for Best Actress in Ironweed View this image ›
Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences / Via youtube.com Look at this absolutely iconic competition.
ID: 10396009 10. 1989: Nominated for Best Actress in A Cry in the Dark View this image ›
Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences / Via youtube.com ID: 10396013 11. 1991: Nominated for Best Actress in Postcards from the Edge View this image ›
Columbia Pictures / Via youtube.com ID: 10396016 12. 1996: Nominated for Best Actress in The Bridges of Madison County View this image ›
Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences / Via youtube.com ID: 10396033 13. 1999: Nominated for Best Actress in One True Thing View this image ›
Lucy Nicholson / AFP / Getty Images Queen Meryl walking the red carpet that was probably rolled out only because she was coming to the ceremony.
ID: 10396052 14. 2000: Nominated for Best Actress in Music of the Heart View this image ›
Craven-Maddalena Films / Via youtube.com I bet you haven’t seen this movie.
ID: 10396064 15. 2003: Nominated for Best Supporting Actress in Adaptation View this image ›
Getty Images ID: 10396069 16. 2007: Nominated for Best Actress in The Devil Wears Prada View this image ›
Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences / Via youtube.com Absolutely breathtaking: She is waving at someone who is not you.
ID: 10396074 17. 2009: Nominated for Best Actress in Doubt View this image ›
Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences / Via youtube.com ID: 10396092 18. 2010: Nominated for Best Actress in Julie & Julia View this image ›
Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences / Via youtube.com Queen of sitting, queen of looking flawless, queen of smiling.
ID: 10396099 19. 2012: Won the Oscar for Best Actress in The Iron Lady Video available at: https://youtube.com/watch?v=rTpaaiPKFw4 . youtube.com ID: 10396104 20. 2014: Nominated for Best Actress in August: Osage County View this image ›
Handout / Getty Images Some fans wanted to take a picture with Queen Meryl!
ID: 10396106 21. 2015: Nominated for Best Supporting Actress in Into the Woods View this image ›
Via yahooentertainment.tumblr.com ID: 10396109 22. 2017: Nominated for Best Actress in Florence Foster Jenkins View this image ›
Paramount Pictures IDK what this movie is about!
ID: 10396134 23. So, in conclusion, I have made a video for you to watch every time that you think to yourself, “Oh, maybe I should tweet about how Meryl Streep is overrated!” Facebook: video.php ID: 10397752 View this image ›
Fox 2000 Pictures / Via giphy.com ID: 10397763
